+
Additionally, [[conspiracy theory|conspiracy theorists]] allege that Google's stated goal of "organizing the world's information" is a [[euphemism]] for its [[hidden agenda]] of [[world domination]]. See also [[Google OS]]/[[GooOS]][http://www.kottke.org/04/04/google-operating-system], [[List of acquisitions by Google]], [[Current TV]]'s [[Google Current]]. This has been accompanied by an almost [[cult icon|cult status]] in the [[open source community]], where Google is seen as the "good guy" among similar corporations, particularly compared to [[Microsoft]]; see [[Mark_of_the_beast#666_as_the_mark_of_commerce|mark of the beast]].
Google has run into trouble with [[copyright infringement]] on several occasions. Two prominent examples are the case of [[Google X]], which [[Apple Computer]] sued over, and [[Gmail]], which was renamed "Google Mail" in the UK and Germany.
Google has run into trouble with [[copyright infringement]] on several occasions. Two prominent examples are the case of [[Google X]], which [[Apple Computer]] sued over, and [[Gmail]], which was renamed "Google Mail" in the UK and Germany.
